description: rocking chair with tall back divided horizontally into three sections; arms and oval seat
text: Since the 1920s this distinctive form of windsor rocking chair, with a three-tiered arrangement of turned spindles, has been found in Sherburne Falls near Lake Champlain, Vermont.  By that tradition, these chairs are thought to have been made by chairmaker John Saxton.  Also, the three-sided medallion in the central stretcher is often seen in New York and Burlington, Vermont chairs of the early 1800s.
title: Windsor rocking chair
